title: Applying the Commutative Property
text: Use the Commutative Property of addition to reorder so that like terms are together: $$\left(-22p\right)+\left(-35p\right)+17q+\left(-27q\right)$$
speech: Use the Commutative Property of addition to reorder so that like terms are together:  negative 22 p, plus negative 35 p, plus 17 q plus negative 27 q
pacedSpeech: Use the Commutative Property of addition to reorder so that like terms are together:   negative 22 p, plus negative 35 p, plus 17 q plus negative 27 q

title: Simplifying the Expression
text: What is the simplified expression once like terms are added?
speech: What is the simplified expression once like terms are added?
